thread.title: Hucci Prefaces Forthcoming Album With Stand-Alone Single 'Life': Exclusive
thread.title_full: Hucci Prefaces Forthcoming Album With Stand-Alone Single 'Life': Exclusive

author: Kat Bein
title: Hucci Prefaces Forthcoming Album With Stand-Alone Single 'Life': Exclusive
text:
Junsei Hucci 
Trap is a genre born and bred in the American South, but it's a sound Britain's grimiest producers have embraced as their own. Mixing the slow, tinny beats with the gloomy, basement sounds of U.K. dubstep and grime, U.K. trap shines as the Southern rap and dance genres' broodier little brother. 
New Zealand-born, England-based Hucci is one example of the U.K.'s dark tweaks. His latest single “Life” cuts vocal samples from hustle king 50 Cent and jam queen Beyoncé around a dark, sludgy trap beat. In an emailed statement, Hucci says he's “striving to make some innovative stuff this year.” It's the first taste of things to come, a sample of the sound fans will hear on his forthcoming LP, inspired partly by his big year of touring in 2016. 
Fans can also look forward to Hucci's first merch drop, a line of streetwear in collaboration with Veyron Arche, coming Feb. 14, just in time for your girl or boy of the hour who can't get enough of that bass. Check “Life” out below exclusively on Billboard Dance .
